Description.Text: Built in the 1970s as an apartment house, Eastgate Tower Suite Hotel remains a quiet retreat for UN personnel and leisure travelers. A small lobby with plasma television also contains a computer with printer providing high-speed Internet access (surcharge). Wireless Internet access (surcharge) is available throughout the hotel. An independent, fine-dining, lunch and dinner restaurant/bar serves Italian cuisine such as seabass in sea-salt crust and pan-seared langostine, and features patio seating in warm weather.

• Park Avenue - 3 blocks • Chrysler Building - 5 blocks • Bryant Park/New York Public Library - 5 blocks • Grand Central Terminal - 6 blocks • United Nations Headquarters - 6 blocks • Times Square - 8 blocks • Broadway theaters - 8 blocks • Empire State Building - 10 blocks • Rockefeller Center - 0.75 mile • Museum of Modern Art - 0.75 mile • Madison Square Garden/Penn Station - 1 mile • Greenwich Village - 1 mile • Carnegie Hall - 1.25 miles • Central Park - 1.25 miles • Central Park Zoo - 1.5 miles • Jacob K. Javits Convention Center - 1.5 miles • Little Italy - 1.75 miles • Soho district - 1.75 miles • Columbus Circle (Time Warner Center, CNN tour, shopping/dining) - 1.75 miles • Chelsea Piers (sports, entertainment) - 2 miles • Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts - 2 miles • Chinatown - 2 miles • Metropolitan Museum of Art - 2.25 miles • American Museum of Natural History - 2.5 miles • Tribeca district - 2.5 miles • Financial District - 3 miles

Eastgate Tower Suite Hotel offers 187 guest suites with light woods and fabrics in a 25-story building. Fully equipped kitchens include four-burner ranges, microwave ovens, and refrigerators. Other amenities include wired and wireless Internet access (surcharges) and two-line speakerphones. Televisions offer pay movies, video games, and Internet access via wireless keyboards. Bathrooms contain shower/tub combinations. Complimentary DVD players and VCRs are available on request.

This fully air-conditioned hotel, appointed in contemporary style, comprises a total of 188 studios and 8 suites set over 28 floors. The modern city hotel greets its guests in an elegant lobby, which features a 24-hour reception, a cloakroom, and several lifts.

• Driving directions from La Guardia: Take Grand Central Pkwy west to I-278 (Brooklyn-Queens Expy) west. Take I-495 (Long Island Expy) west, then take the Queens Midtown tunnel and exit to 37th St/38th-40th Sts. Bear right onto Tunnel Exit St and follow it to E 39th St. • Driving directions from JFK: Take I-678 (Van Wyck Expy) north to I-495 (Long Island Expy) west. Take the Queens Midtown tunnel and exit to 37th St/38th-40th Sts. Bear right onto Tunnel Exit St and follow it to E 39th St. • Driving directions from Newark: Follow signs to take US 1/US 9 north to I-95 (New Jersey Tpke) north (toll road). Take I-495 to the Lincoln Tunnel and exit to West Side Hwy/40th St. Turn left on W 34th St, then turn left on 1st Ave. Turn left on E 37th St, then take the first right onto Tunnel Exit St and follow it to E 39th St.

Room-service breakfast is available from the adjacent Frontier Diner without a delivery charge. The hotel does not have its own restaurant, but there are several dining options within the surrounding area. Nearby restaurants: • Café Trend • Docks Oyster Bar • Seafood Grill
